game

Class Rules

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Rules

  • public class Rules
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains all of the rules and checks for the game. There is a check method for all 8 directions and an accompanying flip method for each The flipAll() and check() methods utilize all 8 of their directional counterparts to check every direction at once
    Since:
    1.8
    Author:
    Garrison

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Rules() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void check(int r, int c, java.lang.String clr)
      The master check method that checks for possible moves in all 8 directions for a disk placed on the board
      void checkXN(int row, int col, java.lang.String colorIn)
      Checks for any possible flips in the negative x direction
      void checkXNYN(int row, int col, java.lang.String colorIn)
      Checks for any possible flips in the third quadrant Checks for out of bounds errors so that row can be greater than, equal to, or less than column
      void checkXNYP(int row, int col, java.lang.String colorIn)
      Checks for any possible flips in the second quadrant Checks for out of bounds errors so that row can be greater than, equal to, or less than column
      void checkXP(int row, int col, java.lang.String colorIn)
      Checks for any possible flips in the positive x direction
      void checkXPYN(int row, int col, java.lang.String colorIn)
      Checks for any possible flips in the fourth quadrant Checks for out of bounds errors so that row can be greater than, equal to, or less than column
      void checkXPYP(int row, int col, java.lang.String colorIn)
      Checks for any possible flips in the first quadrant Checks for out of bounds errors so that row can be greater than, equal to, or less than column
      void checkYN(int row, int col, java.lang.String colorIn)
      Checks for any possible flips in the negative y direction
      void checkYP(int row, int col, java.lang.String colorIn)
      Checks for any possible flips in the positive y direction
      void flipAll(int r, int c, java.lang.String clr)
      Method used after the check() function that Flips all possible moves for the clr colored disk at (r,c) check functions must be used to populate the data field that flipAll() relies on

      Makes any possible flips in the negative x direction

    • Method Detail

      • check

        public void check(int r,
                  int c,
                  java.lang.String clr)
        The master check method that checks for possible moves in all 8 directions for a disk placed on the board
        Parameters:
        r - the row of the disk
        c - the column of the disk
        clr - the color of the disk

      • isMove

        public boolean isMove()
        Method used after the check() function that determines whether there is any possible moves for a given disk check functions must be used to populate the data field that isMove() relies on
        Returns:
        returns true if there are possible moves and false if there are no possible moves
        See Also:
        check(int, int, String)

      • flipAll

        public void flipAll(int r,
                    int c,
                    java.lang.String clr)
        Method used after the check() function that Flips all possible moves for the clr colored disk at (r,c) check functions must be used to populate the data field that flipAll() relies on
        Parameters:
        r - the row of the disk
        c - the column of the disk
        clr - the color of the disk
        See Also:
        check(int, int, String)

        public void checkXPYP(int row,
